Python Workshop

Python

Python is a general-purpose programming language used for a wide range of domains. In addition to its versatility, Python‚Äôs intuitive syntax is relatively easy to read, and makes it perfect for beginners as well as efficient for experienced code maintainers. For instance, you can read and understand following Python code as if it was written in ‚Äúplain English‚Äù,

Hover over with your mouse and click the run button (green triangle). As you might have guessed, this code just prints the following two lines:

Hello there
General Kenobi

In the code, print is a Python command, or more correctly a function, that takes its input which is everything between following ( and ) and outputs it to the console.

Console in programming refers to any interface for interacting with a computer program. Console is usually text based interface, like a terminal application. All executable code and their output fields on this site are also an example of console.

Due to Python‚Äôs wide adoption, Python boasts a vast ecosystem of libraries, frameworks, and packages that extend its capabilities for diverse tasks. These tasks or domains include, but not limited to,

  • Server-side web development,
  • Automation (scripting),
  • Machine learning,
  • Data analysis,
  • ‚ÄúScientific computing‚Äù.

This workshop session will mainly focus on the Python language and its features. The following sessions will follow up with the applications of Python using the science stack.

Science stack is a loosely defined term for a collection of packages and libraries generally used for scientific computing. We will learn more about science stack after we learn basic Python and practice writing some Python code.
